docs.lead_paragraph: A federal report says state standards for access to health care are rarely enforced and that Medicaid patients may wait for months or travel long distances to see a doctor.

headline.main: For Many New Medicaid Enrollees, Care Is Hard to Find, Report Says
headline.print_headline: For Many New Medicaid Enrollees, Care Is Hard to Find, Report Says

docs.abstract: Federal report says state standards for access to care under Medicaid vary widely and are rarely enforced, with patients often waiting for months or traveling long distances to see doctor; report comes as enrollment in program is surging due to Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: A federal report says state standards for access to health care are rarely enforced and that Medicaid patients may wait for months or travel long distances to see a doctor.

docs.lead_paragraph: Digamber Rawat rarely emerges from the tiny windowless room he shares with his parents because a mysterious illness has wasted away the strength in his legs. His family can't afford private health care, but they must pay for it anyway, even when they go to free government hospitals for help.
